blog.name: shippingcast
blog.title: The Shipping (Pod)Cast
blog.description: a fortnightly multi-fandom podcast for the shipper in you, hosted by @shirasade. creating a chain of interviews with fans talking about their otps and why they love them. subscribe and listen now!

summary: Izuku's Home for Wayward Pets, by glamour_weeb
title: Izuku's Home for Wayward Pets, by glamour_weeb
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Izuku works at the Bureau of Companion Protection as a rehabilitator for abused and abandoned Companions, animal-human hybrids. He’s seen his fair share of cruelty cases and even fostered a few Companions, but he’s never had a Companion of his own, until now. After rescuing Katsuki from a life in an illegal, underground Companion fighting ring, Izuku must take in the wolfdog that no one else can handle.

Eventually, Katsuki comes to love his new home, as well as his new Master.

As mentioned on episode 6 of @shippingcast.

blog.name: letmetellyoutabout
blog.title: Let me tell you about...
blog.description: Just another person on the internet with an opinion.

summary: Let me tell you about Boku No Hero (#1) I was reading the newest chapter of Boku no Hero (chapter 214) and I was thinking “Gosh...
caption:
Let me tell you about Boku No Hero (#1)

I was reading the newest chapter of Boku no Hero (chapter 214) and I was thinking “Gosh diggity I fricken love manga and lines and tones and just oh yeah!”  Included these images just because I can see the movement of the still image and they show some of my favorite fights from the series that I think were well balanced by tone and overall line weight that showed the emotion even without the text. 

It got me thinking about the time an acquaintance of mine said that she didn’t like Boku No Hero because of the drawing style and she couldn’t read or watch it.  At that point I really hadn’t read anything for the story so I didn’t really know how to “defend” the story by saying something like “Well, it has really good such and such.” 

But, now I think I could say something like this: Boku no Hero follows a lot of the same troupes that all action manga have examples: rivals, the underdog, high school kids (or around that age range). But, it does a thing with pacing that really sets it apart from the traditional comics! Take Naruto for example in total there are 72 volumes and that includes 18 story arcs (the larger ones) and 700 chapters. The war itself within the story last 2 days but the span of it in Weekly Shounen Jump spanned 2 years! That’s a long time bro! 

Now back to Boku no Hero, as of right now there are 214 chapters and a grand total of 15 story arcs since 2014! If you compare it to other series it moves rather quickly and allows even if you don’t the like the arc (based on the previous paces) it should be over soon and you can move onto the next part. Coughthegentleminiarccough. The movement of the story flows at just the right pace even in longer arcs such as The Rescue Eri Arc. Let’s be real people any other manga we’d still be in the labyrinth trying to save her instead of over  2 arcs away already.

I think about it all the time about what makes people like and dislike things. I guess I’m curious about what drawing styles or stories or a combo of both are deal breakers for people. Not everything can look like Violet Evergreen or Kimi no Nawa or Summer Wars or Ghibli Films or Shingeki No Koyjin (to name a few top visually appealing animes) but there are still sure favorites with “ugly” or not your traditional wow factor drawing styles that are well loved like One Piece, Shin-chan, and like basically the main look of animes in the 80′s and 90′s that has visually not stood the test of time. 

Personally, I put more emphasis on the story than the visuals but the visuals are still very important to me. I do think bottom line for me is that if the story is not that interesting the visuals in my opinion do make up for some of it but don’t equal a well written story. coughswordartonlinecough.

So what’s a deal breaker for you the art style or the story? Do you like me prefer a happy medium?

either way i look forward to seeing what Hori has planned for this
summary: Ok but can we talk about this panel from bnha chapter 209? He’s saying he can hear his little brothers voice - the little...
body:
Ok but can we talk about this panel from bnha chapter 209?

He’s saying he can hear his little brothers voice - the little brother who by all means should be long dead by now in the physical realm. We know of course that his spirit still lives within One for All, but what i’d like to ask is - how can he hear his voice?

Here’s my current theory: Remember before One for All was created, it was two separate quirks, yes? A mix of what the little brother had and the stockpile quirk All for One shoved into his brainbox.

Well what if All for One has some form of connection to One for All because of this hence why he can hear his brothers voice? And if he does have a connection to the quirk, that could mean a part of him, even if it is a tiny part is also within the One for All quirk as well. 

That implication is a lil scary to be honest - cos’ like if there is a part of him inside One for All, what if that starts to make it react in a negative way? How would Izuku be able to handle it if that were to happen?

This combined with the recent reveal in the newest chapters is quite possibly making way for some possibly pretty intense action to come in the future.

blog.name: thatbookwontwriteitself
blog.title: The Procrastination Station
blog.description: Swimming in multi-fandom hell while I procrastinate writing my own. She/Her, though somedays it gets a bit fluid. Proudly Irish. Proudly Jewish. Proudly Christian. And if you're trying to use faith to excuse your bigoted, radicalized, extremist, hateful behavior, you need to keep my God's name the fuck outta your mouth.

summary: Along similar lines to Accidental Quirk Activation When Blushing/Crying/Fuckin/etc... Aizawa rarely gets sick. But when he does...
body:
Along similar lines to Accidental Quirk Activation When Blushing/Crying/Fuckin/etc… Aizawa rarely gets sick. But when he does he’s MISERABLE. Probably prone to migraines, especially since USJ. So Quirk Activation probably makes it WORSE. So it’s just a cycle of misery.

The symptoms makes him hurt and tired which makes him irritatable/miserable which lessens his control which makes his quirk activate when he clenches/spasms any muscle (a sneeze, for instance, or when throwing up) which makes the symptoms worse, repeat.

And it’s not low constant like when blushing/crying, it’s an immediate strong Activate-Release kind of clench, which is sharper and is a much bigger drain on his energy. It gets to the point where his quirk is pulling but getting nothing, shuffling around and sneezing & it tries so hard to activate but all it gets is a splitting headache and a half-hearted lift of hair. Like

“~choo!” [fwuff] *half-sobbing groan of pain*

summary: Given Monoma’s shading when he announces he’s going to use Midoriya’s quirk- it looks like the shading when Midoriya is encased...
body:
Given Monoma’s shading when he announces he’s going to use Midoriya’s quirk- it looks like the shading when Midoriya is encased in lightning = when Midoriya uses the stockpile aspect to release the energy and enhance his strength. But there is no lighting around Monoma.

He only copied the stockpile quirk- without the energy that OfA has collected over the years. And such a quirk only works if it has enough time to actually gather energy. Probably it needs at least hours, if not days.

So of course it didn’t work when he called on his copy - it simply didn’t get anything to work with in the few minutes he had it. Activation was impossible.

(He probably didn’t even get close to the other base aspect of OfA that allows it to be passed on and merge with other quirks.)

trail.content:

He only copied the stockpile quirk- without the energy that OfA has collected over the years. And such a quirk only works if it has enough time to actually gather energy. Probably it needs at least hours, if not days.

So of course it didn’t work when he called on his copy - it simply didn’t get anything to work with in the few minutes he had it. Activation was impossible.

description:
Rating: 18 +
Relationships: Bakugou Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku
Characters: Bakugou Katsuki, Midoriya Izuku, Todoroki Shouto

Summary:

After accidentally hearing Bakugo and Midoriya having sex one night, Todoroki mistakes what he’s hearing for mistreatment and confronts Midoriya on the subject. However, unbeknownst to him, Midoriya’s not the innocent angel that he thinks he is.
